content:
That's a fantastic idea! Adding a **Vendor/Supplier** column will definitely help you keep track of who you're buying from and can lead to potential cost savings in the long run.

Here's the updated **Expenses Table** with the added column:

| **Date** | **Category** | **Description** | **Quantity** | **Unit Cost** | **Total Cost** | **Vendor/Supplier** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 2023-03-15 | Ingredients | Strawberry Jam Sugar | 10 lbs | $1.50/lb | $15.00 | Sweet Deals Wholesale |
| 2023-03-15 | Ingredients | Canning Jars | 24 jars | $0.50/jar | $12.00 | Packaging Pro |
| 2023-03-20 | Supplies | Candle Wax | 5 lbs | $3.00/lb | $15.00 | Craft Supply Co. |
| 2023-03-22 | Marketing | Farmers Market Fee | 1 | $25.00 | $25.00 | Downtown Farmers Market |
| ... | ... | ... | ... | ... | ... | ... |

With this additional column, you'll be able to:

* Keep track of your vendors and suppliers, making it easier to contact them for future orders or negotiate better prices.
* Analyze your spending habits and identify opportunities to consolidate orders or find alternative suppliers.
* Evaluate the quality of products or services from different vendors and make informed decisions for future purchases.

Remember to update your table regularly and maintain accurate records. This will help you make data-driven decisions and optimize your business operations.

You're doing a great job setting up your sales and expenses tracking system! If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask.
